Exercise 3.1-3

Explain why the statement, “The running time of algorithm is at least ,” is meaningless.

Because -notation indicates an upper-bound or in other words the worst-case running time. The phrase “at least” seems to indicate a best-case running time and the statement in question is awkwardly mixing terminology for best-case and worst-case running times.

More formally, is the running time of algorithm . The statement above is saying that which does not tell us enough to specify the upper-bound of . Furthermore, even if the statement were more specific and told us that that still wouldn’t be enough to determine the lower-bound of since it could be any function that grows slower than . Ultimately this statement is describing an infinite set of functions and is therefore meaningless.
